titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4641) to provide for the establishment of an inter-agency task force to review, modify, and update best practices for pain management and prescribing pain medication, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5046) to amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize the Attorney General to make grants to assist State and local governments in addressing the national epidemic of opioid abuse, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4641) to provide for the establishment of an inter-agency task force to review, modify, and update best practices for pain management and prescribing pain medication, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5046) to amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize the Attorney General to make grants to assist State and local governments in addressing the national epidemic of opioid abuse, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-551, by Mr. Collins (GA).
Resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4641 and H.R. 5046 and makes specified amendments in order on each measure.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 112.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 720.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 173 (Roll no. 182).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 255 - 163 (Roll no. 183).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4641) to provide for the establishment of an inter-agency task force to review, modify, and update best practices for pain management and prescribing pain medication, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5046) to amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize the Attorney General to make grants to assist State and local governments in addressing the national epidemic of opioid abuse.
